author: Tom Nolan
title: Mysteries: A Case That Keeps Haunting
text: Michael Koryta’s absorbing and action-filled “How It Happened” (Little, Brown, 359 pages, $27) begins with a grisly confession. Kimberly “Kimmy” Crepeaux—a 22-year-old drug user and notoriously unreliable informant—tells in convincing detail how she was coerced into taking part in the killing of two young people in the small town of Port Hope, Maine. She names Mathias Burke, a respected local caretaker and landscaper (“the paragon of the peninsula”) as principal perpetrator. But Burke won’t admit guilt, and police can’t find the victims—despite Crepeaux’s precise description of how they were stabbed and their bodies...
